oai_dc:dc.dc:title: East Tennessee News press room
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Performing Identity
Media
African American newspapers; African Americans; Newspaper employees; Newspaper presses
Men; Women
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of employees of the East Tennessee News around the printing press.

The East Tennessee News was an African American paper published in Knoxville beginning in 1906 and continuing at least 42 years. Peak circulation may have been almost 10,000 in the early 1920s. The editor and publisher was Webster L. Porter.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Beck Cultural Exchange Center, Knoxville, Tennessee
